alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clark; Codington; Day; Deuel; Grant; Hamlin; Marshall; Roberts; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 1:47PM MST until December 16 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Storm total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Rain will change to snow this evening as temperatures fall below freezing. * WHERE...Portions of northeast South Dakota and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The cold air will freeze wet surfaces and could create icy conditions. The combination of ice, snow, and wind could create difficult travel conditions as well.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, the latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1. In South Dakota, the latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
